title: How to Make Snowball Punch

methods.name: Making a White Punch With Snowballs

steps.headline: Heat the sugar and water.
steps.description: Place 1 cup (225 g) of sugar and 1/2 cup (120 ml) of water in a small saucepan. Turn the heat on to medium-high and stir the mixture occasionally. The mixture should boil and turn syrupy. It's important to boil the water and sugar so that you don't have grainy punch.

steps.headline: Stir in the sweetened condensed milk and almond extract.
steps.description: Remove the pan of syrup from the heat and stir in 1/2 (7 ounces or 200 g) of a can of sweetened condensed milk and 1 1/2 teaspoons of almond extract. Ensure that the sweetened condensed milk is incorporated. The mixture will start to look snowy white after you add the sweetened condensed milk and almond extract. You can use vanilla extract if you prefer the flavor of vanilla over almond.

steps.headline: Combine the punch ingredients.
steps.description: When you're ready to serve the white punch with snowballs, pour the mixture into a punch bowl or two and pour in 3 (2-liter) bottles of lemon-lime soda. Stir the punch gently so it combines. You can prepare the mixture ahead of time. Just refrigerate the punch mixture and add the soda right before you're ready to serve it.

steps.headline: Scoop and float ice cream snowballs.
steps.description: Get out a container of vanilla ice cream or frozen vanilla yogurt. Scoop at least 1/4 of the container into large scoops that resemble snowballs. Gently drop the ice cream snowballs into the punch bowl. If you want a slightly melted effect, consider scooping and adding the snowballs to the punch about half an hour before you plan on serving the punch. This will give the snowballs a chance to melt a little.

steps.headline: Garnish and serve the white snowball punch.
steps.description:
Let your guests help themselves to the punch or ladle the punch into glasses ahead of time. Ensure that each glass has a melting snowball and consider topping the drinks with:
Whipped cream
White snowflake sprinkles
Mini-candy canes

methods.name: Making a Blue Punch With Snowballs

steps.headline: Stir together the fruit punch, soda, and pineapple juice.
steps.description: Pour 1 gallon bottle (3.78 liters) of chilled blue fruit punch, 1 (2 liter) bottle of chilled lemon-lime soda, and 12 ounces (350 ml) of chilled pineapple juice into a large punch bowl. Slowly stir the punch to combine the ingredients. For a brighter blue punch, use less pineapple juice. For a greener, or teal, color, use more pineapple juice.

steps.headline: Scoop and add the ice cream snowballs.
steps.description: Get out one container of vanilla ice cream and scoop 10 large scoops of ice cream. Try to make them as round as you can so they look like snowballs. Set the snowballs into the punch. If you'd like the snowballs to keep they're round shape, you can place the scoops of ice cream on a baking sheet and freeze them until they're completely hard again. Then you can add them to the punch.

steps.headline: Garnish and serve the blue snowball punch.
steps.description: Set out punch glasses so guests can serve themselves or pour the punch into glasses that you can garnish. Consider sprinkling the drinks with blue edible pearls or blue sprinkles. For extra texture, you could also top the drinks with mini-marshmallows.

methods.name: Making a Red Punch With Snowballs

steps.headline: Stir together the cranberry nectar, jam, and soda.
steps.description: Pour 1 (32 ounce or 950 ml) bottle of chilled cranberry nectar, 1 cup (325 g) of chilled seedless red raspberry jam, and 1 1/2 (2 liter) bottles of chilled lemon-lime soda into a large punch bowl. Slowly stir the ingredients. To get the red color, you could also use a fruit jelly (like cherry or strawberry). Just use something that doesn't contain seeds or pieces of fruit.

steps.headline: Scoop and add the frozen yogurt snowballs.
steps.description: Remove 1 (1.5 quart) of frozen vanilla yogurt from the freezer and let it sit out for about 15 minutes. This will soften the frozen yogurt and make it easier to scoop. Scoop the frozen yogurt into round balls that look like snowballs. Add the snowballs to the punch and stir them so they start to melt into the punch. For an even rosier punch, you could use a different flavor of frozen yogurt. Try strawberry frozen yogurt for a really vibrant punch.

steps.headline: Garnish and serve the punch.
steps.description: Set punch glasses near the bowl or fill glasses with the punch. Ensure that you get a snowball in each glass. Top the red punch with fresh cranberries or slices of orange for a holiday touch. To make the cranberries look frosty, rinse them with water and roll them in sugar. The sugar will coat the berries so they look frozen.

text:
Making a White Punch With Snowballs Heat the sugar and water. Place 1 cup (225 g) of sugar and 1/2 cup (120 ml) of water in a small saucepan. Turn the heat on to medium-high and stir the mixture occasionally. The mixture should boil and turn syrupy. It's important to boil the water and sugar so that you don't have grainy punch. Stir in the sweetened condensed milk and almond extract. Remove the pan of syrup from the heat and stir in 1/2 (7 ounces or 200 g) of a can of sweetened condensed milk and 1 1/2 teaspoons of almond extract. Ensure that the sweetened condensed milk is incorporated. The mixture will start to look snowy white after you add the sweetened condensed milk and almond extract. You can use vanilla extract if you prefer the flavor of vanilla over almond. Combine the punch ingredients. When you're ready to serve the white punch with snowballs, pour the mixture into a punch bowl or two and pour in 3 (2-liter) bottles of lemon-lime soda. Stir the punch gently so it combines. You can prepare the mixture ahead of time. Just refrigerate the punch mixture and add the soda right before you're ready to serve it. Scoop and float ice cream snowballs. Get out a container of vanilla ice cream or frozen vanilla yogurt. Scoop at least 1/4 of the container into large scoops that resemble snowballs. Gently drop the ice cream snowballs into the punch bowl. If you want a slightly melted effect, consider scooping and adding the snowballs to the punch about half an hour before you plan on serving the punch. This will give the snowballs a chance to melt a little. Garnish and serve the white snowball punch. Let your guests help themselves to the punch or ladle the punch into glasses ahead of time. Ensure that each glass has a melting snowball and consider topping the drinks with:
Whipped cream
White snowflake sprinkles
Mini-candy canes Making a Blue Punch With Snowballs Stir together the fruit punch, soda, and pineapple juice. Pour 1 gallon bottle (3.78 liters) of chilled blue fruit punch, 1 (2 liter) bottle of chilled lemon-lime soda, and 12 ounces (350 ml) of chilled pineapple juice into a large punch bowl. Slowly stir the punch to combine the ingredients. For a brighter blue punch, use less pineapple juice. For a greener, or teal, color, use more pineapple juice. Scoop and add the ice cream snowballs. Get out one container of vanilla ice cream and scoop 10 large scoops of ice cream. Try to make them as round as you can so they look like snowballs. Set the snowballs into the punch. If you'd like the snowballs to keep they're round shape, you can place the scoops of ice cream on a baking sheet and freeze them until they're completely hard again. Then you can add them to the punch. Garnish and serve the blue snowball punch. Set out punch glasses so guests can serve themselves or pour the punch into glasses that you can garnish. Consider sprinkling the drinks with blue edible pearls or blue sprinkles. For extra texture, you could also top the drinks with mini-marshmallows. Making a Red Punch With Snowballs Stir together the cranberry nectar, jam, and soda. Pour 1 (32 ounce or 950 ml) bottle of chilled cranberry nectar, 1 cup (325 g) of chilled seedless red raspberry jam, and 1 1/2 (2 liter) bottles of chilled lemon-lime soda into a large punch bowl. Slowly stir the ingredients. To get the red color, you could also use a fruit jelly (like cherry or strawberry). Just use something that doesn't contain seeds or pieces of fruit. Scoop and add the frozen yogurt snowballs. Remove 1 (1.5 quart) of frozen vanilla yogurt from the freezer and let it sit out for about 15 minutes. This will soften the frozen yogurt and make it easier to scoop. Scoop the frozen yogurt into round balls that look like snowballs. Add the snowballs to the punch and stir them so they start to melt into the punch. For an even rosier punch, you could use a different flavor of frozen yogurt. Try strawberry frozen yogurt for a really vibrant punch. Garnish and serve the punch. Set punch glasses near the bowl or fill glasses with the punch. Ensure that you get a snowball in each glass. Top the red punch with fresh cranberries or slices of orange for a holiday touch. To make the cranberries look frosty, rinse them with water and roll them in sugar. The sugar will coat the berries so they look frozen.
